By establishing a government data collection program that compiles accurate information on suicide rates, we can better serve law enforcement officers, establish effective prevention practices, and save lives.

A critical step in that mission is understanding the number of officers who attempt suicide or lose their lives to suicide every year. Many non-profits already estimate that suicide takes the lives of more officers than line-of-duty deaths.

Law enforcement officers place themselves in danger for their communities every day, running toward danger when everyone else runs away from it. The least we can do to give back to these brave men and women is to ensure that we fight for their mental health.

When we needed them, they were there for us. We should be there for them. Today, I voted to support our 9/11 heroes so they know the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund will be there to help them and their families as long as they need it.  #Renew911VCF pic.twitter.com/rGybt32RA4
